p: The bacterial strain of Listeria monocytogenes 17/11 (a clinical isolate taken from a patient with listeriosis) was from the National Institute of Public Health in Warsaw (Warsaw, Poland). The strain was stored at −80 °C in 25% glycerol. The frozen strain was transferred to TSA and incubated at 37 °C for 24 h. Then, the culture was transferred to PBS to reach a population of approximately 1 × 10 8 CFU mL −1. The solution was tenfold diluted to 1 × 10 7 CFU mL −1.
